name: Composite Materials
desc: Dune's harsh environment makes composite materials a key part of building a vast and durable infrastructure.

name: Advanced Engineering
desc: These improved construction techniques specific to Arrakis' environment are dedicated to infrastructure efficiency.

name: Modular Parts
desc: Modular parts unlock customization options for your vehicles, such as extra crew cabins in your Harvesters.

name: Geothermal Condensers
desc: Geothermal energy sources can be used for a lot more than charging batteries.

name: Riches of Arrakis
desc: Arrakis teaches the attitude of the knife - chopping off what's incomplete and saying: "Now, it's complete because it's ended here."

name: Insulated Valley
desc: Some places are naturally protected from the scorching winds of Arrakis. With a bit of effort, they can even be made almost livable.

name: CHOAM Integration
desc: Integrating yourself in the regular operation of the CHOAM gives you precious knowledge about the [Spice] trade.
attributes: See next period's [Spice] exchange rate in the Spice Report

name: CHOAM Support
desc: You might be harvesting Spice, but CHOAM distributes it, controls its flow, and gets very rich doing it. That is a powerful friend to have.

name: Crew Training Program
desc: Some Houses consider harvester crews as expendable. Others know in their happiness lies the recipe for the very best Spice yields.

name: Local Dialect Studies
desc: Efforts toward social and cultural integration always help assuage the pyons' fears.

name: Lay of the Land
desc: To the layman, Dune is only a pile of dust. Only those who know the land see the deadly traps and abundant opportunities.

name: Local Hubs
desc: Further fostering local ties helps when it comes to surviving on a planet like Arrakis.

name: Native Customs
desc: Learning the behavior of the locals and knowing when and how to react is an essential first step in gaining their acceptance.

name: Valuable Trinkets
desc: People of all creeds and origins overestimate the value of shiny, decorative objects.

name: Outpost Logistics
desc: Setting up a solid network of outposts generally requires defensive installations, the right people, and convincing gifts.

name: Civilian Defense Force
desc: Training civilians to take care of their own defenses is a key component of keeping a huge territory during war time.

name: Border Defense
desc: These small stations are usually built within villages, allowing for better communication with remote places.

name: Wonders of the Desert
desc: While the desert is often harsh and painful, it can also be beautiful in the right circumstances.

name: Survival Training
desc: Arrakis is the deadliest and most efficient instructor.
attributes: Unlocks the Armory to customize units' equipment

name: Mechanization
desc: Remote-controlled drones and small exoskeletons can help the armed force in many ways.

name: Army Logistics
desc: An army needs a lot of resources to operate, including those found in the field.
attributes: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

name: Recruitment Initiative
desc: Restructuring the army and investing in recruitment is the only way to increase significantly its size.

name: Energy Efficiency
desc: New generations of energy cells are more efficient and durable.

name: Parallel Training
desc: Improved training techniques focusing on autonomy and tutorship from senior trainees allow for faster recruitment.

name: Siege Incentives
desc: Annhiliation of a complete city is a harrowing idea. Most people wouldn't do it. But with the right incentives, you can convince anyone.
attributes: Military units deal ::s_percent_value:: damage against Main Bases
Military Units gives ::value:: [Solari] per damage inflicted on a Main Base

name: Parts Production
desc: The mass production of serialized parts allows for fast and cheap repairs of mechanized units.

name: Military Propaganda
desc: There are times when appearing to be the strongest is more important than actually being so.
attributes: ::target_effects:: if no other factions use more [CommandPoint]

name: Intelligence Network
desc: All agents on the field should be able to input and access information, creating an ever-expanding web of knowledge.
attributes: Getting the chosen result on at least one resolution grants ::value:: [Standing] every Council

name: Diplomatic Maneuvers
desc: Diplomacy is a complex game, one that can be played only by those who accept and even enjoy such intricacies.
attributes: [MinorHouses] deliver a [MinorHousesDonation] near [$my(MainBase)] after every Council

name: Spying Logistic
desc: Not everybody is born a natural spy. Most have to train hard to become one.

name: Counter Measures
desc: Sometimes, the best offense is defense. This is particularly true in espionage and politics.
attributes: After every Council, receive <good>1</good> [LandsraadSoldiers_Dev] per ::value:: [Influence] spent, up to ::value(Dev_CounterMeasures_MaxUnitSpawn)::

name: Landsraad Support
desc: The deep spiral of politics can be overwhelming to newcomers.

name: Nefarious Contacts
desc: Some endeavors require to hire specialists, even if you might not want to meet them eye to eye.

name: Stealth Gear
desc: The best way not to get caught is to not be seen at all.
attributes: ::percent_value:: of an operation's [::target2::] cost is refund when launched in the territory of a faction in [War]

name: Insider Trading
desc: Politicians are as much subject to bribery as anyone else, but the bribe often takes a more subtle form.
attributes: Ignore CHOAM selling cooldown and max [Influence] during the [LandsraadCouncil]

name: Spying Mastery
desc: Secrets are best kept by fewer guardians, and a strong encryption.

name: Local Community
desc: Investing in local communities is the foundation of trust between the people and their leader.

name: Urban Planning
desc: With careful planning and heavy investment, it's possible to build a full city in no time.

name: Atreides Foremen
desc: Loyal workers at key posts will make sure that your assets are maintained in working order.

name: Air Network
desc: On a planet like Arrakis, distant outposts are islands in an ocean of sand. Reaching them on time is often easier by air.

name: Cultural Assimilation
desc: Most people would rather have a tyrant who act like them than a strange but benevolent leader.

name: Veteran Militia
desc: A soldier too old to remain on active duty can be sent as an officer in a far-away outpost. His knowledge will help the local militia with strategic planning and training.

name: Post-Trauma Reintegration
desc: With the proper medical techniques and  thorough psychological care, soldiers who have lived through traumatic experiences can still serve.

name: Proud Liberator
desc: You are on the right side of this fight. Everyone says so. Just enjoy and stop thinking about it!
attributes: Units Liberating or Annexing a [!Village] from a faction with less [Standing] heal ::percent_value:: of [Life] for free

name: Atreides Sympathizers
desc: A pervasive spy network can also be used for benevolent means.

name: Political Entente
desc: With tension rising, gathering friendly houses into an informal alliance is the only way to get some help when chaos inevitably ensues.
attributes: When another faction betrays a [Peace] with [Atreides-longname], receive ::value:: free [::target::]

name: Active Surveillance
desc: To catch a spy in our midst, it is not enough to look within. We must also turn our gaze towards friends and enemies alike.

name: Sustainable Spying
desc: Agents that focus on bringing positive results to their House instead of participating in nefarious plots often end up forming deep and durable alliances.
attributes: [Agent]s assigned on [IChoam], [ILandsraad], or [ISpaceGuild] slots produce ::s_percent_value:: of their associated resources
[Agent] traits present only once on an [!Infiltration] field apply their effects twice

name: Work Ethics
desc: For too long, the lazy have fed off the diligent. No more! House Harkonnen needs men and women willing to give their 200%.

name: Martial Economy
desc: The invisible hand needs a good whip to teach these lazy locals how to be useful to the market.

name: Instill Fear
desc: It is by will alone I set my mind in motion.
attributes: Pillaging a village does not increase its annexation cost
::percent:: [Authority] cost to [Annex] again a [!Village] owned by [Harkonnen-shortname] in the past

name: Savage Cleansing
desc: The savages hide in their dirty burrows. To get rid of that pest would only strengthen our claim on Arrakis.
attributes: Pillaging a [Sietch] for the first time gives ::value:: [Authority] and immediately reveals another [Sietch]
A successful[Pillage] resupply ::s_percent_value:: of max [Supply] of units in the occupation circle

name: Symbols of Authority
desc: Desecration of their symbols is the fastest way to tame the savages' spirit.

name: Adrenaline Addiction
desc: If they do not dread our very name, we have failed!
attributes: Every time a unit dies, ally Military Units that are fighting nearby receive  ::target_effects:: (x::target_stacking_limit:: max)
Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

name: Assembly Lines
desc: Reduce the manufacturing process to its essential gestures, and even the dullest worker can do it.

name: Arrakis Butchers
desc: The butcher cuts off the diseased flesh before it can infect all the meat.

name: Cruel Reputation
desc: It is a good thing they are not too fond of us. It keeps them on their toes and us on our feet.
attributes: Using an operation on a faction in [War] grants ::percent_value:: of its [Solari] cost as [Influence]

name: Landsraad Whispers
desc: Always keeping both ears open and always being ready to jump at an opportunity is the key to a successful Landsraad Council.

name: Enhanced Questionning
desc: With the right tools, an enemy can be more helpful than a friend.

name: Tinkerer Teams
desc: It may only hold together with bits of string and tape, but it's better than breaking apart in the middle of the desert.

name: Underworld Contacts
desc: They say there is no money among friends. Maybe they should find more profitable friends.

name: Criminal Barons
desc: Being able to delegate, to share the leadership roles, makes an underworld empire more nimble.

name: Underground Network
desc: The Smugglers are everywhere and take advantage of every opportunity.

name: Illicit Methods
desc: A tactful shakedown can serve as a reminder of everyone's place on the ladder. No hard feelings.
attributes: Ignore the cost penalty to [Annex] pillaged [!Village]s

name: Organized Looting
desc: Looting seems random and messy to the untrained eye, but getting the most from a chaotic situation requires a coordinated team of rabble-rousers.

name: Guerrilla Tactics
desc: Mixing offense and defense is a sound tactic when you don't have the backing of a Great House.

name: Industrial Scavenging
desc: When a good team is supported by a proper industry of crime, profits are bound to rise.
attributes: Non-mechanical units in the same region as at least ::value:: [S_Drone] consume ::target_effects::
Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

name: Synchronized Heist
desc: If you have enough trusted men, hitting multiple locations at once ensures that at least one will go through.
attributes: On completing a siege, units in the occupation circle gain ::target_effects:: for 1 day
When at least ::value:: sieges are under way against the same faction, ::target_effects::

name: Foot In the Door
desc: Get them to agree to one thing, and they'll agree to anything.
attributes: ::s_percent:: [UWHeadquarters] installation costs within territories of factions in [Peace]
::value:: [Influence] and [Intel] production per faction hosting at least one [UWHeadquarters]

name: Security Details
desc: Important men have important friends, and these friends would be happy to provide protection.
attributes: Receive ::value:: free [Mercenaries] after any resolution choice marked by a [Bounty] passes

name: Underworld Bribes
desc: Listening can get you further than talking.
attributes: Resolutions marked by a [Bounty] receives 1 more vote from the [MinorHouses] per ::value:: [Standing]

name: Freedom Fighters
desc: Those who fight for freedom and self-determination will always find support from those they free.

name: Arrakis Secrets
desc: The offworlders are not the only ones who need vast amounts of Spice.
attributes: When they pack up, [F_Harvester]s leave combat immediately and have [Sneak_Trait] for ::value:: day

name: Sand Brotherhood
desc: The strongest bonds are forged in adversity. Once the desert becomes your home, every visitor is your brother.

name: Shared Transcendence
desc: The [Spice] orgy is an intoxicating experience. The Fremen merge minds in a sensorial whirlwind, if only for an instant.

name: Heir of Arrakis
desc: For as much as the Pan and Graben people see Arrakis as their home, its rightful owners are the Fremen.

name: Desert Wisdom
desc: Fremen numbers are often underestimated. When joining forces, they can accomplish anything.

name: Desert Watchers
desc: The Fremen see all of Arrakis as their duty to protect from the invaders.
attributes: Ally units in [Fremen] territory and near allied [Sietch]s have [Sneak_Trait]

name: Sky Gazing
desc: The open desert is an invitation to look at the night sky and wonder.

name: Desert Trekkers
desc: When you are needed somewhere, the question is not whether you will get there on time, but how.

name: Stalwart Alliance
desc: Fremen society is often fragmented, but everyone agrees on the necessity to remove the offworlder oppressors.
attributes: During the liberation of an enemy [!Village], neighboring allied [Sietch]s send a supporting raid
Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

name: Iday Alakrab
desc: The scorpion keeps its strength hidden and only strikes once victory is certain.
attributes: On exiting wormriding, units inflict ::s_value:: damage on first attack and gain [Sneak_Trait] for a day

name: Fremen Solidarity
desc: Fremen do not agree on everything, in fact they rarely do. But on the subject of offworlders, they make an exception.

name: Sand Diplomats
desc: When a whole planet gets its mind on something, it generally has results.

name: Sietch Network
desc: Each rallied [Sietch] brings the Fremen closer to victory!

name: Solid Materials
desc: The Emperor's stay on Arrakis might be short, but the infrastructure He brings may endure for centuries.

name: Integrated Costs
desc: Infrastructure on the planet can deteriorate quickly without proper care. Integrating most of the maintenance into the [ImpBase] protocols would save costs.

name: CHOAM Manipulation
desc: A good grip on the CHOAM has been used for centuries to keep control of the Great Houses.

name: Megalopolis
desc: Centralization of power and population brings a lot of benefits through economies of scale.

name: Imperial Researchers
desc: Any government needs the support of the intellectual class. It's even more true for a galactic governement.

name: Imperial Administration
desc: Economies of scale are very powerful things that a galactic Emperor uses with abundance.

name: Administrative Consolidation
desc: Continuous investment can make the local economy thrive beyond imagination.

name: Imperial Command
desc: It's the prerogative of the Emperor to commandeer any airport He may need for official business.
attributes: Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

name: Imperial Protocols
desc: The presence of the Emperor alone is often enough to intimidate the bravest nobles of the Imperium.
attributes: ::target_effects:: for Military Units in regions where [Corrino-shortname] has a numerical superiority

name: Absolute Power
desc: One cannot lead without the consent of one's subjects. The trick is to get their consent without their noticing.
attributes: Proposing a [::target::] has no cost if no [Peace] is active
Gain ::value:: [::target::] on Council opening if at least one [Peace] is active

name: Diplomatic Spying
desc: Keep your friends close, but your enemies even closer.
attributes: ::s_value:: [Influence] production per [Agent]s assigned on a faction in [Peace]
::s_value:: [Intel] production per [Agent]s assigned on a faction in [War]

name: Emperor Eyes
desc: No machination can stay hidden for long from the sight of an Emperor.
attributes: ::s_percent:: Military Units cost while victim of a treason

name: Artistic Aspirations
desc: Even the lowest of men want to create, to shape the world to their image. If only we could channel this primal energy into practical matters!

name: Cultural Tourism
desc: Some people are attracted by the quaint and simple lifestyle of Arrakis' pyon. Why not indulge them, for a price?

name: Manichean Propaganda
desc: Who does not like an epic tale with a grand conflict between good and evil? It's hard not to be moved by such a story.
attributes: Other factions lose ::value:: [::target::] when killing an [Ecaz-adjective] [Militia]

name: Native Artists
desc: Even the savage inhabitants of a backwater planet like Arrakis are elevated by the act of creation.

name: Prideful Crown
desc: When you have an amazing jewel, you don't just leave it hanging around. No, you need an equally great casket to display it properly.
attributes: [!Village]s at a distance of ::value:: regions from the [::target::] gain: ::target_effects_list2::

name: National Mythos
desc: What is the difference between a people and a crowd? A story. Good stories you can believe in are the foundation of any patriotism.
attributes: ::target_effects2:: by [Ecaz-adjective] units in a large area around the [TEcazChampion]

name: Martial Perfectionism
desc: When you really want to shine, good enough is not good enough. Everything has to be perfect.
attributes: Can choose to pay ::s_percent_value(PerfectedRecruitment_CostFactor):: of the price to recruit units in ::s_percent(PerfectedRecruitment_TimeFactor):: of the time, giving them permanently: ::target_effects_list::

name: Inspiring Standard
desc: A well-designed flag should show strength and determination, evoking exaltation from any potential onlooker.
attributes: Non-mechanical units in the same region as at least ::value:: [E_Drone] ::target_effects::

name: Logistical Flourish
desc: War is won by the soldiers. But without the support of a precise logistic, they won't be able to show off their skills.
attributes: When a [TEcazChampion] dies, get ::target_effects:: for ::value:: days

name: Cosmopolite Elegance
desc: Elegance and style are the best disguises. The classy type can belong anywhere.

name: Political Art
desc: Art is inherently political. Some artworks assume and shape this component toward a focused objective.
attributes: Any Charter currently claimed by [Ecaz-longname] cannot be proposed to vote

name: Influential Plots
desc: Some people are so likable than they can get away with anything, even publicly.
attributes: When out of [::target::], [::target2::] is used in its stead for mission preparation, assassination upkeep and [Assassin] recruitment

name: Entropic Engineering
desc: [Spice] affects the mind's abilities in unexpected ways. Studying those effects, and the chemical composition of the melange, will require a much better yield from the gatherer.
attributes: Can spend up to 2 [FuelCell] in [$my(harvester)]s to increase their production

name: Spice Enlightenment
desc: As we begin to understand [Spice] as an organic component of the ecosystem, we discover new ways to attract it into our gatherer at a molecular level.
attributes: Can spend up to 4 [FuelCell]s in [$my(harvester)]s to increase their production

name: Sequential Thinking
desc: Most processes happen in order. One step. And the next one. And the next one. Our architectures must reflect and support this pattern.
attributes: The Nodal Network can optionaly connect to [NeuralNode]s across a [DeepDesert]
Each node on the longest path of the Nodal Network gives <good>+0.5</good> [Knowledge] and <good>+2%</good> [Authority] production

name: Neural Tropism
desc: The same species is capable of growing into many different shapes to accommodate the environmental conditions.
attributes: Enemy factions pay ::s_percent_value:: [Authority] to [Annex] a [!Village] neighboring at least <good>2</good> regions connected to the Nodal Network

name: Automated Defenses
desc: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link. It is natural to prioritize protecting our more sensitive spots. The Nodal Network is no exception.
attributes: Connected [NeuralNode]s automatically attack enemy units within your territory
[!Village]s connected to the Nodal Network gain: ::target_effects_list::

name: Water Batteries
desc: Machines, mechanical or organic, require energy to function. But how come can we not power ourselves with sharp electricity? And why could our drones not feed on fresh vegetables?
attributes: When out of [FuelCell]s, [Water] is used in its stead
Unlock the second gear slot in the Armory

name: Guild Collaboration
desc: A navigator is nothing without a ship to pilot. Their elevated world of probability would not exist without our grounded science of machine. It's worth a bit of support.

name: Automated Manufacture
desc: For as much as the Human mind is exquisite, its body is quite frail and demanding. Automating most of the workforce would free our minds and increase the pace of production.
attributes: ::s_percent_value:: recruitment and regeneration speed of all units per [Knowledge]

name: Technological Exchange
desc: The exchange of ideas, the exchange of truth, is the foundation of civilization. In many ways, the communicative scientist is at the heart of society, much more than any emperor.
attributes: Gain ::value:: [Standing] on Council opening per active [Peace]

name: Heretical Computing
desc: A machine would need many different elements to be "thinking". What if one of those elements could be isolated, and used for our purpose?

name: Holistic Thinking
desc: Treating information as isolated bits of knowledge is not enough. To see the whole picture you have to consider things in relation with everything else.
attributes: [!Infiltration] increases by ::value:: level in factions that have accepted a [HarmlessGadget]

name: Physical Wiring
desc: While electromagnetic transmission of data through the air has many advantages, a truly secured connection can only be achieved with good old wires and active surveillance of such wires.
attributes: Each [Statecraft] [!Building_Village] in the [!Village] of such a cell also gives: ::target_effects_list::
